page.title: 16LANDSCAPE IN STOCKSBRIDGE
page.content: THE LANDSCAPE IS HILLY WITH STEEP SCARP EDGES AND GRADUALLY SLOPING HILLS WHICH RUN APPROXIMATELY SOUTH EAST TO NORTH WEST. ON THE HIGHER GROUND ABOVE 800 FEET THERE IS OPEN MOORLAND WITH A FEW STUNTED WINDBLOWN TREES. THE RIVER VALLEYS ARE STEEP SIDED AND HEAVILY WOODED. THERE IS MUCH ROUGH LAND AND A NUMBER OF STUNTED COPSES. THE AREA IS SPLIT UP BY STONE WALLS. THE URBAN LANDSCAPE IS OF 2 MAJOR SORTS, 1. MIXED HOUSING WITH MANY OPEN SPACES, SMALL FIELDS, OLD QUARRIES AND PLAYING FIELDS. 2. HEAVY INDUSTRY AND A RIBBON SHOPPING AREA ADJOINING THE MANCHESTER ROAD. THE SLOPES OF BROOMHEAD RESERVOIR ARE PLANTED WITH SCOTCH PINE, LARCH, NORWAY SPRUCE AND DOUGLAS FIR. WHEN THINNED ARE SOLD FOR FENCE POSTS. WHEN MATURE SOLD FOR COMMERCIAL USE.
